runs.comm: starts over the wicket, pitched up and shaping a touch on off stump, Warner leans into a punchy drive, straight to extra cover
full length again, swinging back a touch and Warner chops the ball on to his front pad, little loose but he gets away with it

lovely timing, just a tickle coming forwards, basically Warner has defended this on the up and beat the fielder, who only had a yard or two to move, it races to the boundary for the first four of the innings
Sohail is pitching the ball up, looking for any movement on offer, Warner is quick to tuck in again, gets this straight back past the bowler but mid-on gives chase

first ball to Finch, nip-backer from Sohail and he's interested, the ball loops to slip but there was not bat involved... Dharmasena gives a serene shake of the head and Misbah decides not to gamble. Looked a little high, Hawk-Eye says it would have just clipped the top of off
length ball around the line of off, Finch taps it defensively into the covers
touch straight to begin with, length ball pinged off the pads by the effervescent Warner, gets a couple through midwicket
pushes this wider, angling away from the left-hander, plinks it off the toe of the bat towards point
slashed but slashed hard, Warner's railway sleeper of a bat gets a chunk of the ball, flies over the head of second slip and away
fullish, around the line of off, comes forward and blocks into the covers
full and wide of the stumps, Warner frees the arms menacingly and hammers the ball along the ground to extra cover
length ball on middle and off, Warner stays back and whips it to the on side, picks out mid-on this time
length ball in the channel outside off, Finch shuffles across, punches it on the up and picks a gap in the covers
decent line, comes forward and blocks to the off side

pitched up, this jags back at Finch and raps him on the pads, Sohail implores for the decision... and Dharmasena gives it! Finch, after a brief conversation with his partner, asks for the review but it only takes a quick look to release this was foolishness. Not much footwork and the ball zipped in with the arm, past the inside edge as he played to leg, and it was crashing into the woodwork halfway up. The finger points skywards for a second time and Pakistan celebrate to the heavens
touch shorter to begin with, outside off stump, Smith gets across to defend
pitched up a little more, coming back into the right-hander, Smith closes the face and nudges to midwicket
length ball around the line of off, gets across and shows it a solid straight bat in defence
stays back and pushes defensively into the off side
length delviery, pushed across, Warner covers up in front of off stump
angled across in the channel outside off, Warner cocks the triggers but mishits into the covers
offered width again, tries to crash it through the off side but again fails to connect properly
punched off the back foot, that's out of the meat, nicely played in front of backward point and he gets a couple
pitched up, inviting the drive and Warner is a man that doesn't need much invitation, slaps it straight to Umar Akmal who fields it cool as you like in the covers
pitched up and tailing in on the stumps, a la Finch's dismissal, Smith plays those in his sleep, though, flicking a leg glance through square for four
length and in the corridor, nibbles away from the batsman, who is happy to leave
gets across in front of off stump and pushes the ball back towards mid-on
good length, well outside off but Smith still turns it to leg, works it wide of mid-on for a single
Sohail fires this across Warner's bows, chops it into the ground and it bobbles towards cover
slightly back of a length, on the stumps, swivels the hips and flicks one through midwicket
starts with a gentle half-tracker and Warner crunches it high over the covers and away for four. Er, we'll call that a loosener
still a touch short and this one veering towards leg, nudged off the hips for a single
continues over the wicket to Smith, back of a length and defended from the crease
too full, Rahat gives up another four ball, in the channel and Smith shows he can play the cover drive too, stroke it through the infield and away
better length, outside off, brings down a straight bat and pushes to mid-off
walks to the off side, Rahat pitches full on middle and is whipped away for three more, Smith likes it there, wristy nudge through midwicket
touch full and well outside off, making sure Smith can't get it off his pads, left alone
similar line, gets on to the front foot and taps defensively into the covers
short ball from Sohail, doesn't get up quite as Smith is expecting, bottom edges a pull down on the pitch
shot! Full outside off, just a half-step into the ball and then the wrists come through, cracks four through extra cover. Another boundary for Smith, who's made a smooth start
shortens his length, straighter line and Smith gets out his big spoon, happily nurdles away to the leg side
length ball outside off, Warner dabs into the off side from the crease
good pace from Rahat, up above 140pkh, Smith uses that to work the ball through square for a couple
goes back and across and defends down the track
fullish, in the channel, gets on the front foot and defends
slightly back of a length, pushed across from over the wicket, Smith hops back and chops the ball towards mid-off
length delivery, decent line around off stump, Smith steers the ball in front of square
nicely played, back-foot punch and he gets the ball between extra cover and mid-off, Misbah gives chase but Smith gets a comfortable two
over the wicket, shortish and a little wide, Warner latches on to it but his cut doesn't quite connect, still nearly runs all the way
back of a length at the body, nudged behind square
wild, down the leg side and Warner whirls his arms at a pull in vain

banged in, short and wide... and Warner has flubbed it straight to third man! Wahab strikes, his 15th wicket of the tournament to go joint third. Warner has gifted him this one, though, was trying to use the pace but really just hung the bat out and steered an uppercut to the fielder, decent low catch from Rahat who ran in a good way
short and angled across, Wahab's hitting 145kph already, left alone
straighter line, Clarke shuffles across and clips a couple firmly through midwicket to get going
slightly back of a length, in the channel, Clarke hangs back and steers a single to third man
bangs this in halfway down, doesn't get up that much and Clarke defends softly on to the pitch
on the stumps and a touch short, works this away through square
continues to drop short, 140kph and over middle and off, Clarke squares up and defends back to the bowler
goes fuller now, around the line of off, shows it the maker's name in defence
pitched up around middle and off, Clarke punches along the ground to mid-on
bit of width, pushed across on a length, hangs back and swats a couple wide of third man
shortish and pulled into the ground through square

back of a length and this gets big on Clarke, who gets on top of it, drops the ball behind backward point and calls for the run, Smith has to get motoring but Ahmed Shahzad's throw misses. Would have been in anyway
banged in at the body, Smith paddles it around the corner for one more

gottim! The short ball works, Clarke dollies it to forward short leg! Don't you love it when a plan comes together... That was well-directed from Wahab, not quite a snorter but awkward enough for a man with an antique spine, rising towards the helmet grill and Clarke can only pop it up off the splice, floats into the hands of the catcher. Maqsood hurls the ball at the floor and screams in delight. Pakistan are in this
slams the ball in short and Watson has to take evasive action, fiery stuff
length this time, 150kph and Watson shapes to play and then raises the bat out of the way... Wahab glares at him for one, two, three seconds, then starts loudly applauding his team-mates
slanted across the right-hander from over the wicket, shaping away off a length and no stroke offered
goes across and works a length ball through the leg side
length ball and this seams a touch as Watson hangs back, wanted to turn to leg but skips off the edge through gully
lovely stuff from Smiffy, calm as you like, waits for the slightly full delivery and then caresses it through the covers, too much gas for Misbah in the end
good length, drops back and pushes into the off side
Rahat has a FSL in now as well, Smith teases him by working a bouncer down and away behind square
steams in, short and rising, worked away through square off the back foot
dug in, spits at Watson, he limbos away, jerking his head at the last minute... Wahab is bringing the heat, as advertised
short again, this time a touch leg side and Watson flinches almost involuntarily... Dharmasena doesn't call wide, either
back of a length, 150kph/93mph and blocked solidly off the back foot
on the stumps, fast and accurate, again Watson defends
a ripper, so close to the glove! Just a fraction short and skidding on at a horrible angle, Watson spasms in the crease but just manages to drop his hands out of the way. Terrific stuff from Wahab
floated up outside off stump, Smith prods into the covers
the googly this time, not sure Smith picked it, an inside edge squirts behind square on the leg side
a touch short - not what you want to see if you're standing where Misbah is - topsinner from Afridi and Watson rocks back to pull one to deep midwicket
length outside off, skids on and driven through the covers to the sweeper
floated up a bit further, drifting towards middle and leg, Smith whips one to long-on
tossed up and Watson pushes back on the off side from the crease
shortish and stabbed away, Maqsood reacts well at short leg to move to his right and cut the ball off
length outside off, still hitting 150kph after the break, blocked into the off side
short and pulled into the ground down through backward square

god golly, that's a helluva ball, Watson does well to keep it down and away from the catcher on the leg side, climbing from just back of a length and thudding into the splice as the batsman threw his hands up
banged in again and this loops towards short leg, won't quite carry! The barrage from Wahab is unrelenting, again had Watson hopping around like a man on coals
short and rising to catch the shoulder of the bat, this flies over the cordon but short of the third man! Serious working over for Watson but he survies
pushed through around off stump, tapped back towards mid-off
walks out and punches a single along the ground to long-on
floated up around the line of off and clipped for four, quick hands from Smith and not afraid to hit against the turn, no one out at deep midwicket and that is a welcome boundary
works this past midwicket again but long-on has moved around and prevents another four
tossed up and punched into the covers
full and on the stumps, again Smith closes the face to send the ball scuttling into a gap square on the leg side

bounced him out, Wahab's plan works a treat... except for Rahat dropping the ball! Oh dear, oh dear, Rahat, what have you done? Straight down the throat of fine leg, Watson never in control of a wild hook but the fielder butchers it. Wahab bellows in frustration, could be a huge moment
angled across, length ball blocked from the crease
shortish outside off, Smith defends down the track to the bowler... and Wahab throws down the stumps in frustration
charges in once again, hits the deck hard and Smith deals with a rising ball around his ribcage, works one through square
vicious lifter from Wahab, ever-so-slightly leg side and Watson gets his equipment out of the way... signalled wide and that's means an extra ball for Watto to survive
close again! Watson is being peppered, again takes his eyes off it, hits high up the bat as he fends away the offending delivery, short of the catcher
pitches this up, aiming for leg-before, Watson has steeled himself and works a couple off his pads
length ball on the stumps, tapped short on the leg side
slightly short, hangs back and punches to the right of extra cover, takes the pace off it but can't prevent a run
half-tracker from Sohail, following Wahab's lead but without the venom, Watson rolls his wrists and clatters four in front of deep square leg
touch short but in the channel outside off, played into the covers
that's a better bouncer, climbing above shoulder height as it whirs back at Watson, only 137kph but beats the attempted pull
banged in even shorter, all height and no trousers, really, and Watson swerves under it
back of a length, 147kph and Smith gets in line, turns behind square
another grumpy bumper from furious Wahab, hits the splice as Watson clings on to his batting existence
slammed in short, very short and called wide as it sails over the batsman...
lets this go a little early, maybe attempting to trap Watson on the crease with a yorker, bunts the full toss back along the ground
short and wanged down the leg side, Wahab losing his line a touch, maybe flagging
dug in at the body, this time Watson gets on top of it and turns the ball down behind square for runs
straight, on a length, gets half forwards and nudges to the leg side
shortish and Watson takes it on the thigh pad, back in the crease... Some of the fire has been doused, could be Wahab's last
good length, Smith comes forward to block
back and across and nudges one through square leg
touch too full from Sohail, in the slot for Watson to cream a drive, all his Wahab troubles forgotten, beats the despairing dive from Misbah and runs away to the cover boundary
full length and tailing towards the pads, Watto clips a couple more through midwicket
off stump, goodish length, Watson plants the front foot and defends
pitched up on the stumps, hasn't got the pace to discomfit the batsman, glanced behind square
length outside off, Watson mistimes a chop into the covers
comes forward and punches the ball towards mid-off on the up
angled across, slightly back of a length and steered through point for a single
sliding across the batsman, looked just about inside the tramlines... but called wide as Smith ignores it
pitched up in the channel, Smith strokes another boundary, pinged through extra cover giving the man in the deep no chance... Raise of the bat for fifty, been a silky knock
touch short, around off stump, jabbed back towards the bowler
pushed towards the slips and Smith taps into the off side coming forwards
short and sitting up outside off, Watson bullies this away for four, front-foot pull and it goes off the bat with a crack through midwicket
Sohail gives up some more loose change, boinging this halfway down and way over the batsman's head
well, this is daft... he's not going to get out if he can't hit them. Pakistan have got carried away with Wahab's success against Watson and Sohail slams another one in that rises too high
better length, still short and climbing towards the throat, defended on the back foot
short ball, skidding through the body but made to look like a long hop by Watson, wheels a pull away and beats fine leg, four more
length outside off and pushed back to mid-off
now that's a bit smarter, slips in the yorker and Watson nearly overbalances, digs it out to midwicket
slightly short, outside off, plays through the line and picks up one through the covers
floated up outside off from around the wicket, drilled to long-off
drops a little short, wide of the stumps and cut off the back foot through point
short again, Watson hangs back and clatters it to extra cover
gives this some air, floated towards off stump, leans out to defend
some turn? Flighted from Sohail, around off stump and straightens to clips the edge as Watson pushes forwards, runs behind square
tossed up and drifting to leg, Smith flicks at it, runs off the pad, I think, to short fine leg
drops a little short, Watson pulls through midwicket
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped square for a single
sliding on with the arm towards leg stump, guided away off the pads behind square
short from Afridi, not got that zip off the surface as yet, Watson crunches a meaty pull down the ground, cut off at long-on
flighted, comes forward, taps one more through mid-on
tossed up, googly on leg stump, worked with the turn (such as it is) to deep square leg
tossed up, played back to the bowler coming forwards
length ball, straightening a fraction outside off, punched down the ground to long-off
floated up on the stumps, Smith dinks one more back past the bowler
very full, gets forward and boshes another single to long-on
flighted, gets Smith reaching around his front pad, pushed back to the bowler a little uncertainly
flatter and swatted away through the covers for the fourth single from the over
angled in with the arm, can't get this one away
skidding on and pushed back
flat on middle stump, Smith gets to the pitch of it anyway and clubs towards long-on, which is vacant, bounces just before the rope
touch short on the stumps, trapped to leg from the crease
flighted outside off, leans out and steers a couple more through the covers
tossed up, luring Smith out and then it dips on him, done in the flight but he manages to thrust his hands out and prevent it slipping past
slightly short of a length, popped into the leg side, aerial shot from Smith but into a gap
slightly short again, outside off, chopped to backward point where Shahzad makes a smart diving stop but can't prevent one
back of a length, around off stump, blocked

fuller, on the stumps, Smith flicks and misses - given! Adil's appeal was almost a lone one, though Sarfraz also went up, Dharmasena gave it some thought before raising the finger. Australia have used their review, so Smith has to trudge off, having looked impenetrable for the last couple of hours. Looked like it would have clipped leg, fairly innocuous ball, Smith not quite as focused as he had been
length on off stump, Maxwell is busy already, pushes at it, opens the face and runs one to third man to get off and running
parsimonious length on off stump, Watson guards his wicket like a sentry
decent line to begin with, Maxwell avoids getting funky, dabs into the covers
goodish length around off stump, prodded carefully back on the off side
pitched up outside off, nice and juicy and Maxwell throws the bat, think the toe hit the ground, there was a sound as it zipped through but Erasmus wasn't interested
length ball around off, 140kph and a tight line, pushed away defensively this time
straighter and hit on the pads, caught him on the move but probably a little high
super shot, timed the pants off that, touch full from Rahat and Maxwell stroked it back past mid-off, first boundary for him
charges in, Watto can see the whites of his eyes from 22 yards away, back of a length and jabbed into the covers

banged in, Maxwell flaps at it, massive miscue, halfway between a ramp and a top-edged saucapan swat, flies way up, down towards third man - but Sohail Khan drops it on the run! Barely gets a hand on it before stumbling over, Wahab screams in anguish for the second time tonight
more chin music, Maxwell decides not to take this one
length ball, fired down the leg side, Maxwell swings at it anyway
rising off a length, shuffles back and across, pushed into the covers for one
length ball on the stumps, clipped of the pads past square leg
shortish, worked off the body into the leg side
back of a length, cramps Maxwell as he tries to force of the back foot, a whisker away from his outside edge
outside off, length this time, pushed into the off side
length ball in the channel, driven on the up to the man at cover
this is just a smidge short but Maxwell contorts himself and manufactures a shovelled-pull through midwicket, in the air but no one there and he gets fours
length outside off, Maxwell reaches for the drive, hits high up the bat but falls short of short extra cover and deflects for one
touch full, in the corridor but Watson is far from uncertain, plants his tree trunk and belabours a cover drive to the boundary
pitched up on leg stump, not quite the yorker and Maxwell times it supremely off his toes for four through mdiwicket
steps to leg, Wahab follows him, drops short and Maxwell somehow blaps it through backward point, sort of a tennis shot, totally off balance and yet is whistles away
bangs this in short, rolls the wrists on a pull, gloves behind square for one
drops back outside off and guides a single off an open bat face
bouncer from Wahab, Maxwell tries to chop down the beanstalk, fails to connect
back of a length again, very leg side... Wahab tiring, I think
goes full and outside the line of off, Maxwell stays still and drills a couple more out to deep extra cover
slower ball from Adil, dips on Watson but he's waiting, slaps it to midwicket and jogs through to complete his half-century
slightly full outside off, Maxwell's arms were born free but he carves the ball to cover
pitched up and defended on the front foot, into the ground and Adil leaps to get a hand on it
fullish and straight, dances across and pings the ball to mid-on
dismissive from Maxwell, little bit of width and he crunches the ball on the up, sails in front of extra cover and away for four
short ball, Maxwell takes the bait, there's a man out there... but he'd need to be in the crowd. Effortless swivel-pulled six to finish the over and kick Pakistan in the bojangles once more
shortish, stays back and blocks to the leg side
there is it, the symbol of victory, Watson takes on the Wahab bouncer and this time nails it into the crowd, over the head of deep square leg. No coming back from here
good length on off stump and Watson defends this, almost theatrically, back to the bowler
veers leg side, back of a length and tickled fine, wide of the keeper and that will run away. Coming in a flood now, Pakistan's World Cup ebbing away
dug in short, outside off stump, Watson gets on top of it and defends to the off side

rapid bumper to finish, Watson ducks the challenge and then gets mouthful of filth from Wahab, who came all the way down to congratulate Australia on their semi-final place pass on his thoughts. Watson chuckles like a baby with a rattle
full and homing on middle and leg stump, glanced fine for a couple
outrageous. But since it's Maxwell, maybe just run of the mill... Full outside off, Maxwell crouches and scoop-slaps the ball into the stands at deep backward point
slower ball on leg stump, spots it and deflects on behind square
pitched up in the channel, driven into the ground, over the bowler's head, Watson sends Maxwell back as mid-off fields

fullish length outside off, driven into a gap, the field is up, Watson raises his arms in celebration... Australia have won by six wickets and will take their place in the last four. It was only briefly in doubt when Wahab Riaz was putting a hex on Watson but two dropped catches off his bowling snuffed out Pakistan's faint hopes
